text: Conrad Worrill (August 15, 1941 â€“ June 3, 2020) was an African-American writer, educator, activist, and talk show host for the WVON call-in program On Target. He was born in Pasadena, California. His activism was focused in Chicago. He was involved with the Million Man March, and the National Black United Front. Worrill called on for greater independence in African-American life. He helped young people better understand the relationships between power and institutions. He was a political advisor to Chicago Mayor Harold Washington. Worrill, who had cancer, died on June 3, 2020 from COVID-19 in Chicago at the age of 78. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American civil rights activists Category:American television presenters Category:American political writers Category:Writers from Chicago Category:Writers from Pasadena, California Category:Educators from Pasadena, California Category:Educators from Chicago Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Chicago
